intro: Souroubea venosa, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic. The plant has a woody stem with a smooth, greyish bark and produces clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Souroubea venosa is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
